item.description:

item.description:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:02:44
item.description:
in reference to:

你的 PDF 和电子书阅读器中的标注，可以自然地这个中心化的 SRS 中找到，而不是封存在某个无法访问的侧边栏中。现代操作系统，会根据聊天消息或电子邮件，尝试创建日历事件或建立联系人。类似地，SRS 系统也可能根据你标为书签的链接，或重复搜索的短语，来尝试创建 SRS 卡片。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:05:35
item.description:
in reference to:

记忆：重复回忆问题；时间间隔随着回答成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 过程的流畅性：重复完成简短练习，有许多变体；时间间隔随着成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 卡片写作：重复问题、模糊的想法、主干想法，从中积累思考，时间跨度为几个月；将卡片标记为「有成果」或「无成果」，以扩大/缩小时间间隔 习惯养成：重复简短的反思卡片，可能根据顺序改变，应用于你的日常经验；间隔默认扩大，但可以放缓 阅读队列：一系列 PDF，标签页，书本，总在变换：如果一段时间内忽略某些内容，它就会暂离一周，之后是一个月；比如说「我现在读够什么了」，这东西就会几天之内再次呈现；说某个东西「不是现在读」，那就几个月，之后是几个月之后再呈现…… 电子邮件收件箱、任务队列、个人通信等

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 中医这件事 in the user temberature at 2022-06-25T14:17:45
item.description:
in reference to:

所以后来索性把医生的眼睛也蒙起来——不告诉医疗人员哪组是安慰剂组哪组是实验组，所有的结果由第三方机构去统计和评判，这就是双盲对照实验。这种测试最大限度地排除了病人的安慰剂效应和医生的主观偏好，成为了判断药物客观疗效最有力的证据，现代医学的“金标准”。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:22:29
item.description:
in reference to:

some of the reasons have nothing to do with choosing the “best learning tool,” but with regards to how my workflow and my life have changed.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:25:54
item.description:
in reference to:

I focused almost entirely on optimizing when I should review the material. My partner made to realize that any spaced repetition algorithm is only half of the story. The other half is how you engage with the material.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:30:38
item.description:
in reference to:

With the benefit of hindsight, one glaring problem is that, what you do to increase the levels of processing (increasing comprehension and making connections) is beyond the scope of any spaced repetition systems; they’re not conducive to (deep) thinking and making connections.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:34:26
item.description:
in reference to:

Linking makes the thinking process tangible: links are the proofs that you’ve connected the material with your prior knowledge. Having a lot of unlinked notes is also proof that different pieces of information exist in isolation.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:35:57
item.description:
in reference to:

But here’s the catch: the connection doesn’t happen automatically. You still have to intentionally and consciously think about the big picture to improve your understanding.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 游牧教室的文具盒：为何真正的学习是舒适的 in the user temberature at 2022-08-17T03:15:15
item.description:
in reference to:

此时的游牧教室，几乎变成了一层套一层的叠加小宇宙。最内层是学生的头脑。包裹着它的，是我们的对话（以及白板互动）。在这一层对话之外，是我的头脑（其中有无数可能突然才想起来的事例、材料，以及数字卡片资料）。而在我的物质身体之外是书库中无数的书架。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated BRE vs ERE (sed, a stream editor) in the user temberature at 2022-08-20T15:00:09
item.description:
in reference to:

With basic (BRE) syntax, these characters do not have special meaning unless prefixed (前缀) with a backslash (‘\’); While with extended (ERE) syntax it is reversed: these characters are special unless they are prefixed (前缀) with backslash (‘\’).

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 教育行业已经没戏了吗？我绝不这么认为 in the user temberature at 2022-08-23T05:53:19
item.description:
in reference to:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 教育行业已经没戏了吗？我绝不这么认为 in the user temberature at 2022-08-23T05:56:44
item.description:
in reference to:

反观美国，早在2017年就有90%的中小学实现了iPad辅助教学，纽约等州还推出了"1:1 iPad"（学生人手一台平板）的计划。此外，还有Google Chromebook这个现象级产品，仅仅2020年的发货量就达到了3000万台，其中绝大部分用于教育。在美国，大学生用Macbook、中小学生用Chromebook、大家都用iPad或Surface，早已成为司空见惯的常态。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Automating Read It Later Articles to DEVONthink - GeekDad in the user temberature at 2022-08-27T04:50:54
item.description:
in reference to:

So when you see something you want to dive into later when you have a bit more time… you have to put it somewhere. That is where a “read-it-later” service like Pocket or Instapaper comes in. Basic features with these services are free, but if you want more advanced features like “search” you have to pay. In the case of Pocket, it will cost you $4.99 a month or $44.99 a year to keep a permanent library of saved articles and be able to search the content of those articles.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/devonthink - Is DEVONthink worth it? in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T04:02:11
item.description:
in reference to:

I suppose it depends what you want to use it for. I use it for research mainly. It is excellent for document storage and analysts and it has been a game changer for me. Coupled with its ability with RSS feeds and Devon agent, I have to say it is superb. I suspect I’m only scratching the surface of its capability. It is a pretty steep learning curve but it’s capabilities are massive.Have a look at the videos on www.screencastsonline.com there is a free membership for 7 days which should give you some idea of what it is capable of. They were a great intro for me.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T09:16:14
item.description:
in reference to:

所以说，再举个用好重器 20% 功能的例子，对于 DEVONthink 来说，我觉得它最重要的就是 Search 搜索功能。比如说我通过 Alfred 的 DEVONthink 插件快速输入「重器轻用」，然后我就可以搜到在 DEVONthink 里面所有关于「重器轻用」的信息。而这个搜索速度是极快的，并且在右侧边栏，你可以看到搜索结果有一个展现的区域，让你快速知道哪些地方有相关文字的一个出处。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T09:16:23
item.description:
in reference to:

其实我就能找到之前所有提到该内容的地方，而这个地方的“快”是非常重要的。我常常把 DEVONthink 比作是一栋楼当中的地下室或者是楼阁，当我们需要找什么内容的时候，我们能够非常快速地去找。虽然说平常不会去楼阁里面翻东西，但只要它搜索起来很快，你就能够快速地去找到想要的内容。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T09:16:42
item.description:
in reference to:

就像我今天要分享的内容，其实是在我看一篇文章的时候，快速记录下的跟文章有关的一些想法，而这些灵感会自动通过 Diigo 同步到 DEVONthink 里面。从而当我回顾时，我就可以通过 DEVONthink 重新打开这篇原文查看当时划线的位置。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T09:20:22
item.description:
in reference to:

另外一个机制是 P.A.R.A 中的 Archive，归档这个概念的意义其实也是非常非常重要的。就像我会把所有内容都归档到我的 DEVONthink 里面，我可以看到我所有的推文、所有的笔记，然后也可以看到我所有的网页高亮，还有我发布过的博客或者是 Newsletter 都会归档到我的 DEVONthink 里面。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Folder Structure to Maximize Writing with Devonthink Pro — Workflows in Personal and Professional Productivity in the user temberature at 2022-09-03T14:29:11
item.description:
in reference to:

Although at one point I had all my information on manuscripts in a single DTP database, over the last year I have maintained separate databases; one for PDFs, another for my annotations.I accomplish this by having separate folders in Dropbox. After extracting my annotations from Highlights.app, I place the exported files in their own folder. Once a month, I export all the PDFs in my Paper’s Library to their own Dropbox folder. I use a Hazel script to throw away any duplicate PDFs in the Dropbox folder. I index (not import) the annotations folder into one DTP database, and index my PDFs into another.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 碳水化合物、蛋白质和脂肪 - 营养障碍 - 《默沙东诊疗手册大众版》 in the user temberature at 2022-11-02T09:25:14
item.description:
in reference to:

人体对鸡蛋中蛋白质的利用率为 100%，牛奶和肉类蛋白质利用率也同样很高。人体对大多数蔬菜和谷物中的蛋白质的利用率略低于 50%。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 碳水化合物、蛋白质和脂肪 - 营养障碍 - 《默沙东诊疗手册大众版》 in the user temberature at 2022-11-02T09:27:38
item.description:
in reference to:

蛋白质通常不用于供应能量。然而，如果人体未从其他营养物质或体内贮存的脂肪中获得足够热量，则会将蛋白质分解为酮体以供应能量。如果蛋白质的消耗量比需要量多，那么人体就会分解蛋白质，然后以脂肪的形式贮存起来。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 碳水化合物、蛋白质和脂肪 - 营养障碍 - 《默沙东诊疗手册大众版》 in the user temberature at 2022-11-02T09:36:29
item.description:
in reference to:

脂肪是供应能量最慢的物质，但却是食物中能量效率最高的。每克脂肪能够供应机体大约 9 卡路里的能量，比蛋白质或者碳水化合物的两倍还多。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How To Take Smart Notes –– Sonke Ahrens in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T06:56:07
item.description:
in reference to:

A note is only as valuable as its context - its network of associations, relationships and connections to other information.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How To Take Smart Notes –– Sonke Ahrens in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T06:56:29
item.description:
in reference to:

"Permanent notes are to be written in a way that can still be understood even when you have forgotten the context they are taken from. "

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How To Take Smart Notes –– Sonke Ahrens in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T06:57:04
item.description:
in reference to:

We want to file information in the context we want to rediscover it in, not the context that we found it in.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How To Take Smart Notes –– Sonke Ahrens in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T07:00:56
item.description:
in reference to:

Useful learning is to connect a piece of information to as many meaningful contexts as possible, which is what we do when we connect our notes in the slip-box with other notes.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Interview and Q&A with Sönke Ahrens on How to Take Smart Notes - Forte Labs in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T07:10:42
item.description:
in reference to:

Reminds me of Gregory Bateson’s definition – information is any difference that makes a difference

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated (91 封私信 / 80 条消息) 为什么饭店的大铁锅从来都不粘锅？ - 知乎 in the user temberature at 2022-11-14T09:28:19
item.description:
in reference to:

正常饭店炒菜流程，首先预热锅，锅的温度加热到200-300度，放油，均匀涂到锅底后立即下食材，这时候油作为导热液体，迅速加热食材表面，食材表面水分剧烈沸腾，莱顿弗罗斯特效应主导，形成一层蒸汽膜，达成不粘。
